I would be fine with them well in July a house voted the house voted to ban smoking on short domestic flights that's most of the flights in the country that bill is now in the hands of the Senate at issue today should we allow smoking on airlines joining us from Washington are Scott staff who is the assistant to the president of the tobacco Institute and Scott ballon who is the vice president of the American Heart Association gentlemen thank you both for joining us today let's talk about how fair a smoking ban would be mr. ballon would that be fair

two smokers I think it would be I don't think we're asking that smokers not smoke at all what we're asking is that non-smokers be protected on flights it's just a frog would it be possible to ban smoking on airlines would that be fair I don't think would be fair at all you know the Civil Aeronautics board just three years ago looked at this question of banning smoking in all commercial aircraft flights the United States and they said the rules are already tilted strongly in favor of non-smokers and they are when you think about it you've got
